<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public class MainActivity extends Activity {
    TextView textView1;

    public void enableBluetooth (View view){
        BluetoothOn ble = new BluetoothOn();
        ble.initializeBlue(this);
    }
}

public class BluetoothOn{
    public void initializeBlue(Activity activity){
        String BleisOn = "connect me now";
        TextView textView1 = (TextView) activity.findViewById(R.id.textView1);
        textView1.setText(BleisOn);
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The findViewById method is a part of the Activity class in Android. It is used to find a view in the current layout using a resource id. In your case, you are trying to use it in a class that is not an Activity, which is why you are getting an error. To fix this, you need to pass the Activity context to your BluetoothOn class and use it to call findViewById. In the code above, we modify the initializeBlue method to accept an Activity parameter. Then, we use this parameter to call findViewById and set the text of the textView1.
